docs.title: Pki-tools Index
docs.text:
Auto-generated documentation index.

A full list of Pki-tools project modules.

PKI tools exposes a high level cryptography API for e.g.:

  • Loading certificates from PEM strings/files/cryptography object into a pydantic model including all x509 v3 extensions
  • Checking revocation of certificates using OCSP with CRL fallback

docs.title: Loading certificate
docs.text:
from pki_tools import Certificate

cert_pem = """
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
<CERT_PEM_BYTES>
-----END CERTIFICATE-----
"""

cert = Certificate.from_pem_string(cert_pem)

docs.title: Loading chain
docs.text:
from pki_tools import Chain

issuer_cert_pem = """
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
<ISSUER_CERT_PEM_BYTES>
-----END CERTIFICATE-----
"""

chain = Chain.from_pem_string(issuer_cert_pem)

docs.title: Checking revocation using OCSP with CRL fallback
docs.text:
The following example is using the cert and chain from the examples above

from pki_tools import is_revoked

if is_revoked(cert, chain):
    print("Certificate Revoked!")

docs.title: is_revoked
docs.text:
Show source in init.py:31

Checks if a certificate is revoked using OCSP extension and/or CRL extension.

By default, the OCSP is checked first with a fallback to CRL. If you only want to check OCSP or only CRL set the "revoke_mode" to either RevokeMode.OCSP_ONLY or RevokeMode.CRL_ONLY

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text:
• cert - The Certificates certificate to check revocation for.
  • chain - The CA chain including one or more certificates and the issuer of the cert, signer of the OCSP response and CRL issuer. See types.Chain for examples how the chain can be created
  • crl_cache_seconds - [CRL Only] Specifies how long the CRL should be cached, default is 1 hour.
  • ocsp_res_cache_seconds - [OCSP Only] Specifies how long the OCSP response should be cached, default is 1 hour.
  • revoke_mode - A types.RevokeMode specifying how to check for revocation, default is OCSP with CRL fallback

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: True if the certificate is revoked, False otherwise

docs.title: Raises
docs.text:
exceptions.SignatureVerificationFailed -- When the Chain contains more than one certificate and the trust fails either because of some certificate has expired or some signature in the chain is invalid

exceptions.RevokeCheckFailed -- When both OCSP and CRL checks fail

docs.title: Signature
docs.text:
def is_revoked(
    cert: Certificate,
    chain: Chain,
    crl_cache_seconds: int = 3600,
    ocsp_res_cache_seconds: int = 3600,
    revoke_mode: RevokeMode = RevokeMode.OCSP_FALLBACK_CRL,
) -> bool: ...

docs.title: is_revoked_multiple_issuers
docs.text:
Show source in init.py:85

Checks if a certificate is revoked first using the OCSP extension and then the CRL extensions.

Note that OCSP has precedence over CRL meaning that if OCSP check is successful this function will return the bool without checking CRL.

Otherwise, if OCSP check fails, CRL will be tried next.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text:
• cert - The Certificates certificate to check revocation for.
  • cert_issuer - The CA chain including one or more certificates and the issuer of the cert. See types.Chain for examples how the chain can be created
  • ocsp_issuer - The CA chain including one or more certificates used for signing of the OCSP response
  • crl_issuer - The CA chain including one or more certificates used for signing the CRL
  • crl_cache_seconds - [CRL Only] Specifies how long the CRL should be cached, default is 1 hour.
  • ocsp_res_cache_seconds - [OCSP Only] Specifies how long the OCSP response should be cached, default is 1 hour.
  • revoke_mode - A types.RevokeMode specifying how to check for revocation, default is OCSP with CRL fallback

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: True if the certificate is revoked, False otherwise

docs.title: Raises
docs.text:
exceptions.SignatureVerificationFailed -- When the Chain contains more than one certificate and the trust fails either because of some certificate has expired or some signature in the chain is invalid

exceptions.RevokeCheckFailed -- When OCSP and/or CRL checks fail(s)

docs.title: Signature
docs.text:
def is_revoked_multiple_issuers(
    cert: Certificate,
    cert_issuer: Chain,
    ocsp_issuer: Chain,
    crl_issuer: Chain,
    crl_cache_seconds: int = 3600,
    ocsp_res_cache_seconds: int = 3600,
    revoke_mode: RevokeMode = RevokeMode.OCSP_FALLBACK_CRL,
): ...

docs.title: verify_signature
docs.text:
Show source in utils.py:16

Verifies a signature of a signed entity against the issuer certificate

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text:
• signed - The signed certificate can either be a Certificate CertificateRevocationList or a OCSPResponse
  • issuer - The Certificate describing the issuer of the signed entity

docs.title: Raises
docs.text: InvalidSignedType -- When the issuer has a non-supported type SignatureVerificationFailed -- When the signature verification fails

docs.title: Signature
docs.text:
def verify_signature(
    signed: [Certificate, CertificateRevocationList, OCSPResponse], issuer: Certificate
) -> None: ...

docs.title: Chain

Pki-tools Index / Pki Tools / Types / Chain

Auto-generated documentation for pki_tools.types.chain module.

docs.title: Chain
docs.text:
Show source in chain.py:17

Chain holds a list of certificates in a chain of trust

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
From File

chain = Chain.from_file("/path/to/chain.pem")

From PEM

pem_string="-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----...."
chain = Chain.from_pem_string(pem_string)

From URI

chain = Chain.from_uri("https://chain.domain/chain.pem")

Using Chain

cert: Certificate = ...
chain.check_chain()
chain.get_issuer(cert)

docs.title: Chain().check_chain
docs.text:
Show source in chain.py:38

Validate the chain (if it contains more than one certificate) checking expiration and signatures of all certificates in the chain

docs.title: Raises
docs.text:
exceptions.NotCompleteChain -- When the chain contain only one not self-signed certificate

exceptions.CertExpired -- If some certificate in the chain has expired

exceptions.InvalidSignedType -- When the issuer has a non-supported type

exceptions.SignatureVerificationFailed -- When the signature verification fails

docs.title: RevokeMode
docs.text:
Show source in enums.py:4

Specifies in what precedence and protocols (OCSP, CRL) to check revocation status of a certificate

docs.title: Attributes
docs.text:
• OCSP_FALLBACK_CRL - Check OCSP first and fallback to CRL if it fails
  • OCSP_ONLY - Only check OCSP and ignore CRL
  • CRL_ONLY - Only check CRL and ignore OCSP

docs.title: Name
docs.text:
Pki-tools Index / Pki Tools / Types / Name

Auto-generated documentation for pki_tools.types.name module.

docs.title: Name
docs.text:
Show source in name.py:13

Name type describes certificate subject or issuer. The attributes are following the RFC5280#Section-4.1.2.4

Note that every attribute is a list of string in order to support multivalued RDNs.

docs.title: Attributes
docs.text:
• c - Country Name (2.5.4.6)
  • o - Organization Name (2.5.4.10)
  • ou - Organizational Unit Name (2.5.4.11)
  • dnq - Distinguished Name Qualifier (2.5.4.46)
  • s - State Or Province Name (2.5.4.8)
  • cn - Common Name (2.5.4.3)
  • serial - Serial Number (2.5.4.5)
  • ln - Locality Name (2.5.4.7)
  • t - Title (2.5.4.12)
  • sn - Surname (2.5.4.4)
  • gn - Given Name (2.5.4.42)
  • i - Initials (2.5.4.43)
  • p - Pseudonym (2.5.4.65)
  • gq - Generation Qualifier (2.5.4.44)
  • dc - Domain Component (0.9.2342.19200300.100.1.25)
